text:
Soon-Tek Oh (, "Oh Sun-taek" – also spelled as Soon-Taek Oh or Soon-Taik Oh or Soon-Teck Oh; June 29, 1932 – April 4, 2018) was a South Korean-American actor and playwright. He was born in Mokpo, South Korea.
Oh was best known for the voice of Fa Zhou in Disney's "Mulan" and the direct-to-video sequel "Mulan II". He has starred in many movies, and also acted in television series, including "MacGyver", "M*A*S*H," "Charlie's Angels", "Airwolf", "Magnum, P.I.", "Hawaii Five-O", "Kung-Fu", "Zorro", and "Touched by an Angel".
Oh died in Los Angeles, California on April 4, 2018 at the age of 85.
